actions.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2699. The resolution waives all points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2(l)(6) of rule XI and clause 7 of rule XXI. All points of order shall be waived during consideration for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2 of rule XXI.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-129, by Mr. Wheat.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 33.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 2699) making appropriations for the government of the District of Columbia and other activities chargeable in whole or in part against the revenues of said District for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 2699 (appropriations for the District of Columbia).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 2699) making appropriations for the government of the District of Columbia and other activities chargeable in whole or in part against the revenues of said District for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.
